THSCA Core Pillars Representation We are committed to representing every coach from every sport in every region of the state. Learn More Advocacy Our network of support and advocacy was designed to put coaches in the best position to succeed no matter the circumstance. Learn More Personal & Professional Development We provide personal and professional development through an array of online and in-person education and training across all sports. Learn More Awards & Recognition We are committed to celebrate the passion and commitment Texas high school coaches in all sports have for developing our student-athletes through recognition and awards programs. Time to take those first steps to make dreams a reality. Best of luck to all athletes, coaches and officials on a great season. @tascosoccer @THSCAcoaches @AustinTGCA Reply on Twitter 1873735955653546034 Retweet on Twitter 1873735955653546034 16 Like on Twitter 1873735955653546034 91 X 1873735955653546034 Keep Up With Us On Who`s fired up for this week`s THSCA Game of the Week?üî• We`ve got a great matchup in store for you as Longview HS and South Oak Cliff HS face off this Friday at 7:30 PM. Catch all the action for FREE on @victoryplus! 13 0 Open ü´µAre you in need of pregame or postgame meals for your team? How about community fundraisers or sponsorship opportunities? Raising Cane`s has got you covered!‚úÖ Click the link in our bio to get connected with your local @raisingcanes! 6 0 Open Have you renewed your THSCA Membership for 25-26? Don`t miss out the chance to nominate your coaches & athletes for THSCA recognitions!üì£ Renewal is available at the discounted $70 rate through Oct. 15! (Standard rate of $90 begins 10/16) 4 0 Open üì¢CALLING ALL COACHES: THSCA is asking ALL sports to use their first home district game to celebrate our Texas Officials! Download the game toolkit by clicking the link in our bio and let`s recognize their efforts and the vital role they play in Texas high school competition!üí´ 7 0 Open PROTECTING EDUCATION-BASED ATHLETICS IN TEXAS‚≠ê Together, these associations represent coaches from every corner of the state in a historic and unified stand to protect education-based athletics‚Äîmarking a first-of-its-kind collaboration that reinforces and strengthens this proud tradition of success. 47 0 Open Happy Birthday to THSCA Assistant Executive Director, Glen West! üéâ Thank you for all that you do for us. We hope you have an amazing day!! 27 0 Open ùóßùóõùóîùó°ùóû ùó¨ùó¢ùó® to all of the school that participated in an Our Day to Shine scrimmage to benefit coaches and athletes in need around the state!üí´ You make us #THSCAStrongüí™ 2 0 Open Want to nominate a coach for the THSCA Hall of Honor? Nominations must be submitted by October 15th for consideration for the Class of 2026. For selection criteria, rules for nomination and a list of current nominees‚û°Ô∏è thsca.com/hoh #THSCAHallofHonor 4 0 Open What Coaches Are Saying THSCA really is the greatest association on the planet. It is consistently evolving to keep coaches equipped to meet the ever-changing needs of this profession. There are personal benefits like the Professional Liability Insurance at a very low price. There are benefits to those in our care through the Benevolence Fund, and then of course the professional networking opportunities provided are second to none. Lee Wiginton Allen HS I have coached high school football in 2 other states. There is no comparison around the country to what the THSCA does for student-athletes, coaches and the state of Texas. I am an awe of what the THSCA represents. It separates Texas from every other state. James Williams Fort Bend Marshall HS This profession we‚Äôre in is undoubtedly challenging, but it‚Äôs also incredibly rewarding. Even on your toughest days, remember the impact you are making. The future of THSCA is incredibly bright, and witnessing it‚Äôs growth and how they work to represent all coaches, students and sports in this state has been an immense source of joy and inspiration for my coaching journey. Amanda Wolf-Schramm Smithson Valley HS Helping Coaches Help Kids Search for: Follow Follow Follow Mailing Address: P.O. Drawer 1138 San Marcos, Texas 78667 Email us: info@thsca.com Call us: 512-392-3741 www.thsca.com

About Who we are & what we do History 20th Anniversay Video Cultural Diplomacy Staff and Contacts Board of Directors Other Mexican Cultural Institutes Mexico in New York Activities OPEN DOORS Annual Reports Octavio Paz Gallery The Gallery Current Exhibition Previous Exhibitions LAS MUJERES OAXAQUE√ëAS: LA TIERRA Y LA LUZ Dinner and conversation June 28, 7 PM // DeMaria photo: Andrea Gentl Join us for a conversation with chef Aurora Toledo and mezcalera Graciela √Ångeles Carre√±o of Real Minero on the traditional and changing roles of women in food and mezcal in Oaxaca.¬†Preceded by welcome cocktails, followed by four-course meal created in collaboration between Aurora Toledo and chef Adriana Urbina of DeMaria, paired with mezcal Real Minero. In partnership with Pocoapoco and with the generous support of Interjet and the Mexico Tourism Board. Menu: - Garnachas istme√±as : traditional appetizers from the Isthmus of Tehuantepec made from corn masa, topped with beef and pickled vegetables. - Molotes de pl√°tano : fried plantain filled with queso fresco. - Mole negro : one of the most iconic dishes of Oaxaca. Rich sauce prepared with three different types of smoked chiles , spices, nuts, plantain, and chocolate, among other ingredients. Served with fish. - Camote y pi√±a : chefs Aurora and Adriana will collaborate on a fresh sweet potato and pineapple dessert, ideal for the summer. $150.00 Add to cart About the Participants: Pocoapoco is a multi-disciplinary, research-based residency program in Oaxaca, Mexico offering time for retreat, a platform for creative exploration and space for a collective intelligence. The residency hosts artists and non-artists in a wide variety of fields to support research, conversation and community surrounding creative work, process and purpose. Graciela √Ångeles Carre√±o is the mezcalera and general manager of Real Minero Mezcal, an internationally recognized brand from the small town of Santa Catarina Minas. As part of the fourth generation of mezcal producers, she is committed to her role as a modern women coexisting in an industry dominated by men, acting as an evangelist of mezcal and representing a new generation of mezcaleras. Aurora Toledo is the chef and founder of the highly respected restaurant Zandunga in the center of Oaxaca. Growing up in the Isthmus region of Oaxaca, she is also a lifelong teacher and educator, as well as mother, grandmother and community leader. She is currently training as a traditional healer. Where : DeMaria 19 Kenmare St, NY When : June 28, 7 PM 27 East 39th Street, New York, NY, 10016, Estados Unidos (212) 217-6400 programs@mciny.org Hours Mon 09:00 - 18:00 Tue 09:00 - 18:00 Wed 09:00 - 18:00 Thu 09:00 - 18:00 Fri 09:00 - 18:00 Sat CERRADO Sun CERRADO
